I donâ€™t know if this is intended or a bug: when you set a value for `inline_help_text` in the `meta.json` of a module, this text shows up in the module settings when editing a page. But if your module has no fields, this text is not showing up.
It is useful to display this help to the page editors, even if there is no fields to edit.

If I want to allow a couple different styles of tables in a theme, presumably I need a custom module to present the options as module fields (style a, style b). I don't want to recreate table-editing functionality using module fields (it doesn't sound THAT hard, but I bet it's harder than assumed!). What's the best way to go here? Just make a module with rich text that prepopulates with a table as a "hint" to the user?

Appreciate your advice, thanks!
